tags.name: (v2) Connection Controller
tags.description: Use these endpoints to create connections, which are used to create jobs. Additional information about integration connections can be found in [our documentation](https://helpdocs.objective.com/3sixty_user/Content/connections/connectors.htm).

tags.name: (v2) Job Controller
tags.description: Use these endpoints to find, create and update jobs. Additional information about jobs can be found in [our documentation](https://helpdocs.objective.com/3sixty_user/Content/integrations/jobs-overview.htm)

tags.name: (v2) Task Controller
tags.description: Use these endpoints to help populate tasks when creating a job. Additional information about tasks can be found in [our documentation](https://helpdocs.objective.com/3sixty_user/Content/integrations/processors.htm).

get.summary: Retrieve a job using its id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id

put.description: Updates a job using a complete job objects. If changing the repoId or outputId, appropriate specification fields for the new connection type must be included, or the call will fail

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id

delete.description: Jobs associated with job groups, schedules, or data collection cannot be deleted

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id

get.summary: Retrieve the array of tasks on a job

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id

put.summary: Replace a job's tasks with a new array
put.description: Uses an Array of [task objects](https://helpdocs.objective.com/3sixty_user/Content/developers/api/v2/api-objects.htm#Tasks) to replace the current tasks on a job

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id

get.summary: Retrieve the array of post processors for a job

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id

put.summary: Replace a post processors with a new array
put.description: Uses an Array of [task objects](https://helpdocs.objective.com/3sixty_user/Content/developers/api/v2/api-objects.htm#Tasks) to replace the post processors on a job. Use **/v2/connections/{typeId}/postprocessors/list** for a list of usable post processors for your connection types

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id

get.summary: Retrieve the array of mappings for a job

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id

put.summary: Replace a job's mappings with a new array
put.description: Uses an Array of [mapping objects](https://helpdocs.objective.com/3sixty_user/Content/developers/api/v2/api-objects.htm#Mappings) to replace the current mappings on a job.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A job id

get.summary: Get a connection using and id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A connection id

put.summary: Update a connection using a complete job object

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A connection id

requestBody.description: typeId must be included, but is immutable. Changing authType requires a new set of properties or the call will fail

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A connection id

patch.summary: Partially update a connection with a JSON object

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A connection id

requestBody.description: Keys and Values for this object should be found using **connectors/{typeId}/{authType}**. The request object must be a flat JSON. Property keys can be included with name and description. authType and typeId are immutable

Update Object.description: A flat JSON containing the key/value pairs of the fields to update

put.description: Updates the metadata index of the specified document.

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The collection (Mongo) or Index (ElasticSearch) of document

parameters.name: docId
parameters.description: The identifier for the document. Form varies depending on source/indexing engine.

parameters.name: jsonString
parameters.description: A json body containing index fields and their new values

put.description: Updates the metadata index of the specified document.

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The collection (Mongo) or Index (ElasticSearch) of document

parameters.name: jsonString
parameters.description: A json body containing a list of document ids and an object containing new property values

put.summary: Edit security marks and declassify document.
put.description: sscontroller.editDocSecurity.notes

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The collection (Mongo) or Index (ElasticSearch) of document

parameters.name: jsonString
parameters.description: A json containing a list of jsons representing the documents to update. Only mark ids can be used for the secMarks attribute.

post.description: Adds a list of security marks to a list of documents. Note that if the document is a record, the marks must be added separately using POST /rm/security

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The collection (Mongo) or Index (ElasticSearch) of document

parameters.name: jsonString
parameters.description: A json containing a list of document ids and either a list of mark names (marks) or a list of mark ids (markIds).If one of the security marks is part of a classified security group, this will also classify a document. Document's may only have one classification.

put.summary: Update Principal Security using a  list of marks passed n the body.

parameters.name: principal
parameters.description: The principal to update. Can be the login of a user or user group name

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of principal. "user" or "group.

parameters.name: markIds
parameters.description: The request body. A list of security mark ids

get.description: Retrieve a Transfer Destination by id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Transfer Destination id

parameters.name: destinationStr
parameters.description: JSON Object containing parameters for transfer destination creation: displayName: (String), Maximum 100 characters, description: (String), address: (String)

parameters.name: destinationStr
parameters.description: JSON Object containing parameters for transfer destination creation: displayName: (String), Maximum 100 characters, description: (String), address: (String)

delete.summary: Delete a Transfer Destination by id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Transfer Destination id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the security group.

parameters.name: groupString
parameters.description: A json containing the following fields: id: (Long) (optional) if populated with a current group id, this will be an update name: (String) The name of the group type: (String) How the group checks security marks, can be "ANY", "ALL", or "HIERARCHICAL" marks: (List) (optional) The list of security marks for this group. If not present, the group will have no marks classified: (boolean)(optional) Whether adding marks from this group classifies a document classifiedAgency: (String) (optional) If classified, classifying agency classifiedBy: (String) (optional) If classified, classifying authority classifiedReason: (String) (optional) If classified, reason for classification colorHex: (String) (optional) The color of security mark badges in the UI

parameters.name: groupString
parameters.description: A json containing the following fields: id: (Long) (optional) if populated with a current group id, this will be an update name: (String) The name of the group type: (String) How the group checks security marks, can be "ANY", "ALL", or "HIERARCHICAL" marks: (List) (optional) The list of security marks for this group. If not present, the group will have no marks classified: (boolean)(optional) Whether adding marks from this group classifies a document classifiedAgency: (String) (optional) If classified, classifying agency classifiedBy: (String) (optional) If classified, classifying authority classifiedReason: (String) (optional) If classified, reason for classification colorHex: (String) (optional) The color of security mark badges in the UI

delete.description: A group which contains a mark that is in use cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the security group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the security group.

parameters.name: markName
parameters.description: The name of the new mark

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position of the mark. 0 is the highest position.

parameters.description: The id of the schedule

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The name of the Retention Schedule

put.summary: Renames a schedule, provided it has no records.
put.description: Requires RM Officer Role

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the schedule

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new schedule name

put.summary: Edit security marks and declassify records.
put.description: Only available to Security Officers. Overwrites the security marks on each of the specified records. Can also flag the records as declassified.

parameters.name: jsonString
parameters.description: json containing a list of jsons representing the records to update. Only mark ids can be used for the secMarks attribute.

post.summary: Edit security marks and declassify records.
post.description: Only available to Security Officers. Overwrites the security marks on each of the specified records. Can also flag the records as declassified.

parameters.name: jsonString
parameters.description: A json containing a list of record ids and either a list of mark names (marks) or a list of mark ids (markIds).If one of the security marks is part of a classified security group, this will also classify the record. Records may only have one classification.

put.description: Will immediately check steps from its schedule after setting the value

parameters.name: fieldString
parameters.description: A JSON String containing:recordId: String, record Id for the document,fieldKey: String, The custom field key, value: Object (number, date, string), the values for the custom field

get.description: Retrieves data for a hold based on the id

parameters.name: holdId
parameters.description: The hold Id.

put.description: Creates and returns a new hold.

parameters.name: holdString
parameters.description:
JSON with parameters for creating a Hold. Lengths are expressed using [length][unit].

Example: 

3M = 3 Months

1d = 1 Day 

4w = 4 Weeks

post.description: Creates and returns a new hold.

parameters.name: holdString
parameters.description:
JSON with parameters for creating a Hold. Lengths are expressed using [length][unit].

Example: 

3M = 3 Months

1d = 1 Day 

4w = 4 Weeks

delete.description: Deletes a hold with the supplied id. Fails if the hold is in use by any record.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The hold Id.

get.description: Retrieves Custom Metadata field by field id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Custom Field Id. Cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters or spaces.

put.description: Update a custom metadata field

parameters.name: fieldString
parameters.description: JSON Object containing parameters for field creation: displayName: (String) Maximum 100 characters, description: (String) id: (String) Maximum 20 characters. Cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters or spaces type: (String) Options are date, number, and text

post.description: Create a new Custom Metadata field.

parameters.name: fieldString
parameters.description: JSON Object containing parameters for field creation: displayName: (String) Maximum 100 characters, description: (String) id: (String) Maximum 20 characters. Cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters or spaces type: (String) Options are date, number, and text

delete.description: Deletes Custom Metadata field by field id if it is not in use.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Custom Field Id. Cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters or spaces.

put.summary: Complete multiple events on a record.
put.description: Requires RM Officer Role. Completes multiple events, then checks for step completion.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The record Id. Takes the form of [timestamp]_[source repository id]

parameters.name: eventsString
parameters.description: Post body containing a json with which events to complete. Does not support the input of custom field data

put.summary: Complete an event on a record.
put.description: Requires RM Officer Role. Completes an event on a record, then checks for step completions

parameters.name: fieldData
parameters.description: (Optional) If a custom event requires population of a custom field, data should be included as a JSON Object

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The record Id. Takes the form of [timestamp]_[source repository id]

parameters.name: eventKey
parameters.description: A key for a disposition step event

get.description: Retrieves Custom Events by field

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id for the event. Event ids are a minimum of five characters and cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters

put.description: Update an existng Custom Event

parameters.name: eventString
parameters.description: JSON Object containing parameters for field creation: displayName: (String) Maximum 100 characters, description: (String) Maximum 256 characters, id: (String) Maximum 20 characters. Minimum 5 characters. Cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters or spaces customFieldKey: (String) The key to a custom field that must be populated when this event is completed

post.description: Create a new Custom Event

parameters.name: eventString
parameters.description: JSON Object containing parameters for field creation: displayName: (String) Maximum 100 characters, description: (String) Maximum 256 characters, id: (String) Maximum 20 characters. Minimum 5 characters. Cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters or spaces customFieldKey: (String) The key to a custom field that must be populated when this event is completed

delete.description: Deletes Custom Metadata field by field id if it is not in use.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id for the event. Event ids are a minimum of five characters and cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters

put.description: Creates a new version of a document. Uses the content of the request body as the version's content.

parameters.name: docId
parameters.description: The source repository ID of the file. The format will differ based on repository.

parameters.name: metadataVersionOnly
parameters.description: If true, only update the metadata of the new version, do not change the content.

delete.description: Deletes a specific version of a document.

parameters.name: versionSeriesId
parameters.description: The Version ID.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The Version Series ID.

parameters.name: docId
parameters.description: The Document ID (the ID of the repository file).

example.message: Successfully deleted version [versionId:1234][versionSeriesId:512] of document [docId:_vti_history/512/Shared Documents/MyDocument.txt]

put.description: Updates the provided repository file's (specified by its ID/name) content or properties. The content should be the binary body of the PUT request. A file ID or the folder ID along with the file name is needed, depending on your repository. If no binary content is in the request, the request parameters will be used to update properties of the same name on the document.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: The source repository ID of the file. The format will differ based on repository.

parameters.name: mimetype
parameters.description: The mimetype of the file.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The repository ID of the folder that the file you are updating is in.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the file. (Based on your target repository)

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of the file.

example.message: Error updating file [id:] [folderId:] for connection [content-service-connector-id] Error: Request must include folderId Or fileId
example.error: Request must include folderId Or fileId

put.description: Updates the properties of a repository file. This uses the parameters sent in the request to update properties of the same name as your file.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: The source repository ID of the file. The format will differ based on repository.

put.description: Updates the provided repository file's (specified by its ID) content or properties. The content should be the binary body of the PUT request.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: The source repository ID of the file. The format will differ based on repository.

parameters.name: docId
parameters.description: The source repository ID of the file. The format will differ based on repository.

parameters.name: holdId

put.description: Creates a hold for a piece of active content and flags the index.

parameters.name: docId
parameters.description: The source repository ID of the file. The format will differ based on repository.

parameters.name: holdId

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The content service connectorId for the content. If the lock method is available for that connector, it will be performed on the document.

parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

get.description: Retrieve a PII Rule by Id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The source repository ID of the file. The format will differ based on repository.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of a PII Rule

put.description: Create a rule using a JSON body. Requires Administrator access. Returns a JSON representation of the new rule.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The source repository ID of the file. The format will differ based on repository.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that will appear in PII reports and metadata. Can be alphanumeric with spaces.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A Regular Expression

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Whether or not to use the rule when performing PII Scans and detection.

post.description: Create a rule using a JSON body. Requires Administrator access. Returns a JSON representation of the new rule.

parameters.name: jsonBody
parameters.description: A JSON object containing an alphanumeric key (spaces allowed) and a regular expression body. If the "active" field is not present, the default value is true.

delete.description: Deletes a rule with the provided id. Requires Administrator access.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The source repository ID of the file. The format will differ based on repository.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of a PII Rule

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N). Default 0

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: How many results to return per page. Default 10

post.description:
Creates a job using the passed body.

Passing an empty readSpec or outputSpec will generate the default values for the connector.

Use **/v2/api/connections/{typeId}/specification** to determine the specification fields or [check our docs](https://helpdocs.objective.com/3sixty_user/Content/developers/api/v2/api-job-specs.htm)

get.summary: Get a page of available connections

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N). Default 0

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: How many results to return per page. Default 10

requestBody.description: Keys and Values for the "properties" object should be found using **connectors/{typeId}/{authType}**

post.description: Saves a view search for the specified user. Can also overwrite a previous search. The parameters for this method are 'username', 'viewId', 'id', 'query', 'facets', 'name', and 'description'. Returns a JSON representation of the newly saved search. username : The username of the user to save this new search to. Ex: admin viewId : The View ID of the view you wish to save the new search to. Ex: search-view-id id : The ID of the existing saved search to update. Leave blank to make a new search. Ex: 1594927840229 query : The query of your search. Ex: content:content to search for facets : Search facets to be saved with the search. Ex: simflofy_filename:\*nametosearch\* name : The name of the search. Ex: Example Search description : A description of the saved search. Ex: A short description of this search

results.name: Example Search
results.description: A short description of this search

post.description: Deletes the specified search for a user of the specified view. The parameters for this method are 'username', 'viewId', and 'id'. Returns a JSON list of saved searches after deletion. username : The username of the user you wish to delete the search from. Ex: admin viewId : The View ID of the view the search is being deleted from. Ex: search-view-id id : The ID of the search to be deleted. Ex: 1594927840229

results.name: Example Search 2
results.description: A short description of this other search

post.summary: Run Full Query against a collection
post.description: Runs a search on the given search connection using the query provided. Refer to online documentation on Content Search REST Services and your specific search connection type for more information.

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The collection (Mongo) or Index (ElasticSearch) of document

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: A full query for the target system. Supported systems are MongoDB, ElasticSearch, and Solr.
parameters.example: Refer to indexing engine documentation for how to construct a query for your system.

post.summary: Ensure the given field is mapped.
post.description: Needed by ElasticSearch to prevent mapping parser exception.

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The collection (Mongo) or Index (ElasticSearch) of document

parameters.name: mappingString
parameters.description: A key value map of fields and their types. Types don't matter for MongoDB, but they do for ElasticSearch.

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The collection (Mongo) or Index (ElasticSearch) of document

parameters.name: docString
parameters.description:
A JSON Body containing at least the following required fields

simflofy_filename: The name of the document 

simflofy_connectorId: The id of the Content Service Connector associated with the document's content

source_repository_id: The id ofthe document in the source repository. This will vary widely. Check the indexes of similar repos for examples

parameters.name: docId
parameters.description:
(Optional) The id that will be assigned to the document. If left blank the id will be autogenerated in the case of ElasticSearch, or use

the current source_repository_id, in MongoDB.

post.summary: Run Full Query with configured collection
post.description: Runs a search on the given search connection using the query provided. Refer to online documentation on Content Search REST Services and your specific search connection type for more information.

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: A full query for the target system. Supported systems are MongoDB, ElasticSearch, and Solr.
parameters.example: Refer to indexing engine documentation for how to construct a query for your system.

post.description: Takes a query or documents and generates an xml file or zip file based on the parameters. All search security is checked before export.

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: The Connector ID of your search connection

parameters.name: paramsJSON
parameters.description: A JSON String containing the export parameters which are: docs : An array of search documents. The simflofy_filename, source_repository_id search fields are required. This simflofy_connectorid is required for downloads query : Will be checked if the docs argument is not present. A Search Service query string. edrm : A boolean value which tells the service to generate the export in EDRM format download : A boolean value which tells the service to include document content with the export, and create a zip file. message : Optional string for traceability of the export viewId : Optional string for traceability of the export

post.description: RM Manager role is required for destroy, undeclare, and delete. Otherwise RM Officer Role is required.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Bulk Action to Perform. Options are cutoff, transfer,destroy, addhold, removehold, declare, delete, and undeclare

parameters.name: bulkBody
parameters.description: A JSON containing an array of record Ids on which to performt he action (a path variable). If adding or removing a hold, the holdId is required.

post.description: Requires RM Manager Role. Undeclares a document as a record. Will delete all RM metadata related to the document

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The record Id. Takes the form of [timestamp]_[source repository id]

post.description: Requires RM Officer Role. Cuts off the supplied record if eligible

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Security Mark

parameters.name: markString
parameters.description: A json containing the following fields: id: (Long) (optional) only use this to update a mark's name. groupId: (Long) The id of the Security Group which owns this mark. Marks without groups are not accessible through the UI name: (String) The name of the security mark

delete.description: Marks that have been applied to content can never be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Security Mark

post.summary: Performs a search on all Managed Records
post.description: Will return a String representation of a JSON that will contain a list of records (also JSON) as well as a count of total documents that fit the search criteria.

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description:
The body containing search parameters. Currently only the "fields" is used. 

 Example: {"fields":{"isDestroyed":true}}. 

 OR searches are also available. Example: {"fields":{"tagName":"One schedule OR Another Schedule"}}. 

 Partial text searches are also available. {"fields":{"tagName":".\*One sched.\*"}}

post.description: Will export record metadata that match the supplied search criteria. Will include the document's name, schedule tags, disposition dates, and owner.

parameters.name: searchBody
parameters.description:
The body containing search parameters. Currently only the "fields" is used. 

 Example: {"fields":{"isDestroyed":true}}. 

 OR searches are also available. Example: {"fields":{"tagName":"One schedule OR Another Schedule"}}. 

 Partial text searches are also available. {"fields":{"tagName":".\*One sched.\*"}}

parameters.name: asPdf
parameters.description: Export as PDF, otherwise export as CSV

parameters.name: repName
parameters.description: Name of the exported report. Can only contain alphanumeric character. Will be included in pdf as well as a timestamp.

post.description: Requires RM User Role. Will return a list of successes and failures as well as the created records.

parameters.name: recordString
parameters.description: JSON Object containing the information needed to create the records

post.description: Requires RM Manager Role. Destroy a record. Will trigger deletion of the source document. The metadata will remain if the destroy step is configured to keep a report.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The record Id. Takes the form of [timestamp]_[source repository id]

post.description: Requires RM Manager Role. Deletes a document in the source repository and all RM metadata.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The record Id. Takes the form of [timestamp]_[source repository id]

The body containing search parameters. Currently only the "fields" is used. 

 Example: {"fields":{"isDestroyed":true}}. 

 OR searches are also available. Example: {"fields":{"tagName":"One schedule OR Another Schedule"}}. 

 Partial text searches are also available. {"fields":{"tagName":".\*One sched.\*"}}

post.description: Will export record audits that match the supplied search criteria. Can also file the export as a record.

parameters.name: searchBody
parameters.description:
The body containing search parameters. Currently only the "fields" is used. 

 Example: {"fields":{"isDestroyed":true}}. 

 OR searches are also available. Example: {"fields":{"tagName":"One schedule OR Another Schedule"}}. 

 Partial text searches are also available. {"fields":{"tagName":".\*One sched.\*"}}

parameters.name: asPdf
parameters.description: Export as PDF, otherwise export as CSV

parameters.name: reportToRecord
parameters.description: Declare the generated report a record.

parameters.name: connId
parameters.description: Required if reportToRecord is true. The Content Service Connection to export the file to. Pass an empty string if reportToRecord is false.

parameters.name: scheduleId
parameters.description: Id of the schedule to file the report under. Pass 0 if reportToRecord is false.

parameters.name: repName
parameters.description: Name of the exported report. Can only contain alphanumeric character. Will be included in pdf as well as a timestamp.

parameters.name: deleteAudits
parameters.description: Clear the exported audits from the database after successful export.

get.summary: Retrieve a full list of available tasks and their fields
get.description:
Example is a truncated response.

**Note:** The fields **use_condition**, **task_condition**, and **task_stop_proc** are always optional.

See **[Our Documentation](https://helpdocs.objective.com/3sixty_user/Content/developers/api/v2/api-task-specs.htm)** for more details on these fields.

duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.name: Check a condition before executing this task.

duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.description:
It will execute the task when the condition's result is 'true', 't', 'on', '1', or 'yes' (case-insensitive), or run on all conditions if left empty.
This condition is evaluated for each document, determining whether the task should be executed based on the specified values.
duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.name: Condition

duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.description: If the condition results in 'true', 't', 'on', '1', or 'yes' (case-insensitive), no additional tasks will be executed for the current document being processed.
duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.name: Stop Processing

duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.description: Check for duplicates in this Job or across the enterprise.
duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.name: Duplication Check Scope

duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.description: Should checking for duplicates be case sensitive or not?
duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.name: Case Sensitive?

duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.description: Additional Fields to check for narrowing the scope of the search for duplicates. Checks to make sure the documents that match, have the same values between these fields as well.
duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.name: Equal Fields

duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.description: Additional Fields to check for narrowing the scope of the search for duplicates. Similar to the Equals Fields, except this will check to make sure the chosen values are NOT the same between the documents.
duplicateFileNameRenamerTask.name: Not-Equal Fields

filterExpressionTask.name: Check a condition before executing this task.

filterExpressionTask.description:
It will execute the task when the condition's result is 'true', 't', 'on', '1', or 'yes' (case-insensitive), or run on all conditions if left empty.
This condition is evaluated for each document, determining whether the task should be executed based on the specified values.
filterExpressionTask.name: Condition

filterExpressionTask.description: If the condition results in 'true', 't', 'on', '1', or 'yes' (case-insensitive), no additional tasks will be executed for the current document being processed.
filterExpressionTask.name: Stop Processing

get.summary: Retrieve information for a single task or post-processor based on its type id
get.description:
Type ids for tasks can be found using the **/tasks** and **/tasks/names** endpoints, use **connectors/{typeId}/postprocessors/list** to find post-processor type ids.

**Note:** The fields **use_condition**, **task_condition**, and **task_stop_proc** are always optional.

See **[Our Documentation](https://helpdocs.objective.com/3sixty_user/Content/developers/api/v2/api-task-specs.htm)** for more details on these fields.

parameters.name: taskTypeId
parameters.description: The type id of the task or post-processor to return

fields.name: Check a condition before executing this task.
Condition
fields.description:
It will execute the task when the condition's result is 'true', 't', 'on', '1', or 'yes' (case-insensitive), or run on all conditions if left empty.
This condition is evaluated for each document, determining whether the task should be executed based on the specified values.

fields.name: Stop Processing
fields.description: If the condition results in 'true', 't', 'on', '1', or 'yes' (case-insensitive), no additional tasks will be executed for the current document being processed.

get.description: Retrieves the record status of a specific document from a specific job.

parameters.name: docId
parameters.description: The document ID from a ran job. Examples of these can be seen by viewing a job run in The Job Run History page.

parameters.name: recordType
parameters.description:
The record type of the status you wish to retrieve. This parameter can be the following: 


p : Processed
r : Read
e : Error
d : Duplicate
s : Skipped

example.results: RecordProcessAction: [jobId=1576854997410, jobRunId=1576854997410_1576856105585, jobName=Example Job Name, docUri=/Users/example/files/textfile.txt, docId=/Users/example/files/textfile.txt, docName=textfile.txt, docType=document, docHash=null, docPath=null, versionId=null, versionSeries=null, contentLength=3631, createdDate=Fri Dec 20 10:35:10 EST 2019,contentType=txt/plain] ,[message=null, newId=30de26f7-4e4e-4b9f-b11d-e0ec2088b252, docHash=null, lastModified=Mon Dec 02 14:28:37 EST 2019

get.description: Aborts a 3Sixty job by its ID.

parameters.name: docId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the file, if not provided one will be created.

parameters.name: isRM
parameters.description: (Optional) Will determine whether to search record holds or document holds. Default is false

parameters.name: searchConnId
parameters.description: (Optional) The search connection associated with the document. If empty, the holds will be searched soley on Document Id.

get.summary: Get User's Exports and Public Links
get.description: Returns two lists, files and links, containing json representations of the files and links the user has created.
Retrieves a user's file based on the the id provided. Ids can be gathered using the files/user endpoint

Takes arguments to create a public download link: docId: The id of the document. If this file is managed by Simflofy, use the id from the `/files/user` endpoint internal: Lets Simflofy know whether this file is internally managed or exists in an external source connectorId: (optional) If the files is externally managed, the connectorId of a Content Service Connector that can access it. fileName: The name of the file, required if connectorId is not supplied lifeSpan: (optional) The number of days the link will be valid for. Defaults to 3 if not supplies

delete.description: If the file is complete, the file's size will be returned. If the file is not done processing, the process will be killed and the file discarded. A value of 0 will be returned.
